noun.description: A shaped tool or die for giving a desired form to metal by hammering or pressure.
A groove, ridge, or other molding on an object.

verb.description: Shape (metal) using a swage, especially in order to reduce its cross section.
examples: the instrument has a swaging head and a pulsed action which flattens the rivet in a series of rolling motions

origin: Late Middle English (in swage (sense 2 of the noun)): from Old French souage decorative groove, of unknown origin.
